page.title: 18A Walk from Fyfield
page.content: The most convenient parking is in the road to Lockeridge. A quarter of a mile along the A4 road towards Calne is a path northwards through Piggledene, a valley of sarsen stones. Bear westwards for half a mile to pass barns, farm buildings and an old cottage. Now turn right into{Fyfield Down {Nature Reserve.}After a mile turn east into Stony Valley, and so out of the nature reserve again. This is called Clatford Bottom. On the way back to the A4 you pass the dolmen called Devil's Den. You are now less than a mile from Fyfield where you started the walk. There is a footpath beside the road, rather unpleasant because of the traffic, or a longer route on the south side of the A4, heading first towards Clatford and then to Lockeridge.
